18///! Provides the [`SharedNodeCache`], the [`SharedValueCache`] and the [`SharedTrieCache`]
19///! that combines both caches and is exported to the outside.
20use super::{CacheSize, NodeCached};
21use hash_db::Hasher;
22use nohash_hasher::BuildNoHashHasher;
23use parking_lot::{Mutex, RwLock, RwLockWriteGuard};
24use schnellru::LruMap;
25use std::{
26	collections::{hash_map::Entry as SetEntry, HashMap},
27	hash::{BuildHasher, Hasher as _},
28	sync::Arc,
29};
30use trie_db::{node::NodeOwned, CachedValue};
31
32lazy_static::lazy_static! {
33	static ref RANDOM_STATE: ahash::RandomState = {
34		use rand::Rng;
35		let mut rng = rand::thread_rng();
36		ahash::RandomState::generate_with(rng.gen(), rng.gen(), rng.gen(), rng.gen())
37	};
38}
39
40pub struct SharedNodeCacheLimiter {
41	/// The maximum size (in bytes) the cache can hold inline.
42	///
43	/// This space is always consumed whether there are any items in the map or not.
44	max_inline_size: usize,
45
46	/// The maximum size (in bytes) the cache can hold on the heap.
47	max_heap_size: usize,
48
49	/// The current size (in bytes) of data allocated by this cache on the heap.
50	///
51	/// This doesn't include the size of the map itself.
52	heap_size: usize,
53
54	/// A counter with the number of elements that got evicted from the cache.
55	///
56	/// Reset to zero before every update.
57	items_evicted: usize,
58
59	/// The maximum number of elements that we allow to be evicted.
60	///
61	/// Reset on every update.
62	max_items_evicted: usize,
63}
64
65impl<H> schnellru::Limiter<H, NodeOwned<H>> for SharedNodeCacheLimiter
66where
67	H: AsRef<[u8]>,
68{
69	type KeyToInsert<'a> = H;
70	type LinkType = u32;
71
72	#[inline]
73	fn is_over_the_limit(&self, _length: usize) -> bool {
74		// Once we hit the limit of max items evicted this will return `false` and prevent
75		// any further evictions, but this is fine because the outer loop which inserts
76		// items into this cache will just detect this and stop inserting new items.
77		self.items_evicted <= self.max_items_evicted && self.heap_size > self.max_heap_size
78	}
79
80	#[inline]
81	fn on_insert(
82		&mut self,
83		_length: usize,
84		key: Self::KeyToInsert<'_>,
85		node: NodeOwned<H>,
86	) -> Option<(H, NodeOwned<H>)> {
87		let new_item_heap_size = node.size_in_bytes() - std::mem::size_of::<NodeOwned<H>>();
88		if new_item_heap_size > self.max_heap_size {
89			// Item's too big to add even if the cache's empty; bail.
90			return None
91		}
92
93		self.heap_size += new_item_heap_size;
94		Some((key, node))
95	}
96
97	#[inline]
98	fn on_replace(
99		&mut self,
100		_length: usize,
101		_old_key: &mut H,
102		_new_key: H,
103		old_node: &mut NodeOwned<H>,
104		new_node: &mut NodeOwned<H>,
105	) -> bool {
106		debug_assert_eq!(_old_key.as_ref(), _new_key.as_ref());
107
108		let new_item_heap_size = new_node.size_in_bytes() - std::mem::size_of::<NodeOwned<H>>();
109		if new_item_heap_size > self.max_heap_size {
110			// Item's too big to add even if the cache's empty; bail.
111			return false
112		}
113
114		let old_item_heap_size = old_node.size_in_bytes() - std::mem::size_of::<NodeOwned<H>>();
115		self.heap_size = self.heap_size - old_item_heap_size + new_item_heap_size;
116		true
117	}
118
119	#[inline]
120	fn on_cleared(&mut self) {
121		self.heap_size = 0;
122	}
123
124	#[inline]
125	fn on_removed(&mut self, _: &mut H, node: &mut NodeOwned<H>) {
126		self.heap_size -= node.size_in_bytes() - std::mem::size_of::<NodeOwned<H>>();
127		self.items_evicted += 1;
128	}
129
130	#[inline]
131	fn on_grow(&mut self, new_memory_usage: usize) -> bool {
132		new_memory_usage <= self.max_inline_size
133	}
134}
135
136pub struct SharedValueCacheLimiter {
137	/// The maximum size (in bytes) the cache can hold inline.
138	///
139	/// This space is always consumed whether there are any items in the map or not.
140	max_inline_size: usize,
141
142	/// The maximum size (in bytes) the cache can hold on the heap.
143	max_heap_size: usize,
144
145	/// The current size (in bytes) of data allocated by this cache on the heap.
146	///
147	/// This doesn't include the size of the map itself.
148	heap_size: usize,
149
150	/// A set with all of the keys deduplicated to save on memory.
151	known_storage_keys: HashMap<Arc<[u8]>, (), ahash::RandomState>,
152
153	/// A counter with the number of elements that got evicted from the cache.
154	///
155	/// Reset to zero before every update.
156	items_evicted: usize,
157
158	/// The maximum number of elements that we allow to be evicted.
159	///
160	/// Reset on every update.
161	max_items_evicted: usize,
162}
163
164impl<H> schnellru::Limiter<ValueCacheKey<H>, CachedValue<H>> for SharedValueCacheLimiter
165where
166	H: AsRef<[u8]>,
167{
168	type KeyToInsert<'a> = ValueCacheKey<H>;
169	type LinkType = u32;
170
171	#[inline]
172	fn is_over_the_limit(&self, _length: usize) -> bool {
173		self.items_evicted <= self.max_items_evicted && self.heap_size > self.max_heap_size
174	}
175
176	#[inline]
177	fn on_insert(
178		&mut self,
179		_length: usize,
180		mut key: Self::KeyToInsert<'_>,
181		value: CachedValue<H>,
182	) -> Option<(ValueCacheKey<H>, CachedValue<H>)> {
183		match self.known_storage_keys.entry(key.storage_key.clone()) {
184			SetEntry::Vacant(entry) => {
185				let new_item_heap_size = key.storage_key.len();
186				if new_item_heap_size > self.max_heap_size {
187					// Item's too big to add even if the cache's empty; bail.
188					return None
189				}
190
191				self.heap_size += new_item_heap_size;
192				entry.insert(());
193			},
194			SetEntry::Occupied(entry) => {
195				key.storage_key = entry.key().clone();
196			},
197		}
198
199		Some((key, value))
200	}
201
202	#[inline]
203	fn on_replace(
204		&mut self,
205		_length: usize,
206		_old_key: &mut ValueCacheKey<H>,
207		_new_key: ValueCacheKey<H>,
208		_old_value: &mut CachedValue<H>,
209		_new_value: &mut CachedValue<H>,
210	) -> bool {
211		debug_assert_eq!(_new_key.storage_key, _old_key.storage_key);
212		true
213	}
214
215	#[inline]
216	fn on_removed(&mut self, key: &mut ValueCacheKey<H>, _: &mut CachedValue<H>) {
217		if Arc::strong_count(&key.storage_key) == 2 {
218			// There are only two instances of this key:
219			//   1) one memoized in `known_storage_keys`,
220			//   2) one inside the map.
221			//
222			// This means that after this remove goes through the `Arc` will be deallocated.
223			self.heap_size -= key.storage_key.len();
224			self.known_storage_keys.remove(&key.storage_key);
225		}
226		self.items_evicted += 1;
227	}
228
229	#[inline]
230	fn on_cleared(&mut self) {
231		self.heap_size = 0;
232		self.known_storage_keys.clear();
233	}
234
235	#[inline]
236	fn on_grow(&mut self, new_memory_usage: usize) -> bool {
237		new_memory_usage <= self.max_inline_size
238	}
239}
240
241type SharedNodeCacheMap<H> =
242	LruMap<H, NodeOwned<H>, SharedNodeCacheLimiter, schnellru::RandomState>;
243
244/// The shared node cache.
245///
246/// Internally this stores all cached nodes in a [`LruMap`]. It ensures that when updating the
247/// cache, that the cache stays within its allowed bounds.
248pub(super) struct SharedNodeCache<H>
249where
250	H: AsRef<[u8]>,
251{
252	/// The cached nodes, ordered by least recently used.
253	pub(super) lru: SharedNodeCacheMap<H>,
254}
255
256impl<H: AsRef<[u8]> + Eq + std::hash::Hash> SharedNodeCache<H> {
257	/// Create a new instance.
258	fn new(max_inline_size: usize, max_heap_size: usize) -> Self {
259		Self {
260			lru: LruMap::new(SharedNodeCacheLimiter {
261				max_inline_size,
262				max_heap_size,
263				heap_size: 0,
264				items_evicted: 0,
265				max_items_evicted: 0, // Will be set during `update`.
266			}),
267		}
268	}
269
270	/// Update the cache with the `list` of nodes which were either newly added or accessed.
271	pub fn update(&mut self, list: impl IntoIterator<Item = (H, NodeCached<H>)>) {
272		let mut access_count = 0;
273		let mut add_count = 0;
274
275		self.lru.limiter_mut().items_evicted = 0;
276		self.lru.limiter_mut().max_items_evicted =
277			self.lru.len() * 100 / super::SHARED_NODE_CACHE_MAX_REPLACE_PERCENT;
278
279		for (key, cached_node) in list {
280			if cached_node.is_from_shared_cache {
281				if self.lru.get(&key).is_some() {
282					access_count += 1;
283
284					if access_count >= super::SHARED_NODE_CACHE_MAX_PROMOTED_KEYS {
285						// Stop when we've promoted a large enough number of items.
286						break
287					}
288
289					continue
290				}
291			}
292
293			self.lru.insert(key, cached_node.node);
294			add_count += 1;
295
296			if self.lru.limiter().items_evicted > self.lru.limiter().max_items_evicted {
297				// Stop when we've evicted a big enough chunk of the shared cache.
298				break
299			}
300		}
301
302		tracing::debug!(
303			target: super::LOG_TARGET,
304			"Updated the shared node cache: {} accesses, {} new values, {}/{} evicted (length = {}, inline size={}/{}, heap size={}/{})",
305			access_count,
306			add_count,
307			self.lru.limiter().items_evicted,
308			self.lru.limiter().max_items_evicted,
309			self.lru.len(),
310			self.lru.memory_usage(),
311			self.lru.limiter().max_inline_size,
312			self.lru.limiter().heap_size,
313			self.lru.limiter().max_heap_size,
314		);
315	}
316
317	/// Reset the cache.
318	fn reset(&mut self) {
319		self.lru.clear();
320	}
321}
322
323/// The hash of [`ValueCacheKey`].
324#[derive(PartialEq, Eq, Clone, Copy, Hash)]
325#[repr(transparent)]
326pub struct ValueCacheKeyHash(u64);
327
328impl ValueCacheKeyHash {
329	pub fn raw(self) -> u64 {
330		self.0
331	}
332}
333
334impl ValueCacheKeyHash {
335	pub fn from_hasher_and_storage_key(
336		mut hasher: impl std::hash::Hasher,
337		storage_key: &[u8],
338	) -> Self {
339		hasher.write(storage_key);
340
341		Self(hasher.finish())
342	}
343}
344
345impl nohash_hasher::IsEnabled for ValueCacheKeyHash {}
346
347/// The key type that is being used to address a [`CachedValue`].
348#[derive(Eq)]
349pub(super) struct ValueCacheKey<H> {
350	/// The storage root of the trie this key belongs to.
351	pub storage_root: H,
352	/// The key to access the value in the storage.
353	pub storage_key: Arc<[u8]>,
354	/// The hash that identifies this instance of `storage_root` and `storage_key`.
355	pub hash: ValueCacheKeyHash,
356}
357
358/// A borrowed variant of [`ValueCacheKey`].
359pub(super) struct ValueCacheRef<'a, H> {
360	/// The storage root of the trie this key belongs to.
361	pub storage_root: H,
362	/// The key to access the value in the storage.
363	pub storage_key: &'a [u8],
364	/// The hash that identifies this instance of `storage_root` and `storage_key`.
365	pub hash: ValueCacheKeyHash,
366}
367
368impl<'a, H> ValueCacheRef<'a, H> {
369	pub fn new(storage_key: &'a [u8], storage_root: H) -> Self
370	where
371		H: AsRef<[u8]>,
372	{
373		let hash = ValueCacheKey::<H>::hash_data(&storage_key, &storage_root);
374		Self { storage_root, storage_key, hash }
375	}
376}
377
378impl<'a, H> From<ValueCacheRef<'a, H>> for ValueCacheKey<H> {
379	fn from(value: ValueCacheRef<'a, H>) -> Self {
380		ValueCacheKey {
381			storage_root: value.storage_root,
382			storage_key: value.storage_key.into(),
383			hash: value.hash,
384		}
385	}
386}
387
388impl<'a, H: std::hash::Hash> std::hash::Hash for ValueCacheRef<'a, H> {
389	fn hash<Hasher: std::hash::Hasher>(&self, state: &mut Hasher) {
390		self.hash.hash(state)
391	}
392}
393
394impl<'a, H> PartialEq<ValueCacheKey<H>> for ValueCacheRef<'a, H>
395where
396	H: AsRef<[u8]>,
397{
398	fn eq(&self, rhs: &ValueCacheKey<H>) -> bool {
399		self.storage_root.as_ref() == rhs.storage_root.as_ref() &&
400			self.storage_key == &*rhs.storage_key
401	}
402}
403
404impl<H> ValueCacheKey<H> {
405	/// Constructs [`Self::Value`].
406	#[cfg(test)] // Only used in tests.
407	pub fn new_value(storage_key: impl Into<Arc<[u8]>>, storage_root: H) -> Self
408	where
409		H: AsRef<[u8]>,
410	{
411		let storage_key = storage_key.into();
412		let hash = Self::hash_data(&storage_key, &storage_root);
413		Self { storage_root, storage_key, hash }
414	}
415
416	/// Returns a hasher prepared to build the final hash to identify [`Self`].
417	///
418	/// See [`Self::hash_data`] for building the hash directly.
419	pub fn hash_partial_data(storage_root: &H) -> impl std::hash::Hasher + Clone
420	where
421		H: AsRef<[u8]>,
422	{
423		let mut hasher = RANDOM_STATE.build_hasher();
424		hasher.write(storage_root.as_ref());
425		hasher
426	}
427
428	/// Hash the `key` and `storage_root` that identify [`Self`].
429	///
430	/// Returns a `u64` which represents the unique hash for the given inputs.
431	pub fn hash_data(key: &[u8], storage_root: &H) -> ValueCacheKeyHash
432	where
433		H: AsRef<[u8]>,
434	{
435		let hasher = Self::hash_partial_data(storage_root);
436
437		ValueCacheKeyHash::from_hasher_and_storage_key(hasher, key)
438	}
439
440	/// Checks whether the key is equal to the given `storage_key` and `storage_root`.
441	#[inline]
442	pub fn is_eq(&self, storage_root: &H, storage_key: &[u8]) -> bool
443	where
444		H: PartialEq,
445	{
446		self.storage_root == *storage_root && *self.storage_key == *storage_key
447	}
448}
449
450// Implement manually so that only `hash` is accessed.
451impl<H: std::hash::Hash> std::hash::Hash for ValueCacheKey<H> {
452	fn hash<Hasher: std::hash::Hasher>(&self, state: &mut Hasher) {
453		self.hash.hash(state)
454	}
455}
456
457impl<H> nohash_hasher::IsEnabled for ValueCacheKey<H> {}
458
459// Implement manually to not have to compare `hash`.
460impl<H: PartialEq> PartialEq for ValueCacheKey<H> {
461	#[inline]
462	fn eq(&self, other: &Self) -> bool {
463		self.is_eq(&other.storage_root, &other.storage_key)
464	}
465}
466
467type SharedValueCacheMap<H> = schnellru::LruMap<
468	ValueCacheKey<H>,
469	CachedValue<H>,
470	SharedValueCacheLimiter,
471	BuildNoHashHasher<ValueCacheKey<H>>,
472>;
473
474/// The shared value cache.
475///
476/// The cache ensures that it stays in the configured size bounds.
477pub(super) struct SharedValueCache<H>
478where
479	H: AsRef<[u8]>,
480{
481	/// The cached nodes, ordered by least recently used.
482	pub(super) lru: SharedValueCacheMap<H>,
483}
484
485impl<H: Eq + std::hash::Hash + Clone + Copy + AsRef<[u8]>> SharedValueCache<H> {
486	/// Create a new instance.
487	fn new(max_inline_size: usize, max_heap_size: usize) -> Self {
488		Self {
489			lru: schnellru::LruMap::with_hasher(
490				SharedValueCacheLimiter {
491					max_inline_size,
492					max_heap_size,
493					heap_size: 0,
494					known_storage_keys: HashMap::with_hasher(RANDOM_STATE.clone()),
495					items_evicted: 0,
496					max_items_evicted: 0, // Will be set during `update`.
497				},
498				Default::default(),
499			),
500		}
501	}
502
503	/// Update the cache with the `added` values and the `accessed` values.
504	///
505	/// The `added` values are the ones that have been collected by doing operations on the trie and
506	/// now should be stored in the shared cache. The `accessed` values are only referenced by the
507	/// [`ValueCacheKeyHash`] and represent the values that were retrieved from this shared cache.
508	/// These `accessed` values are being put to the front of the internal [`LruMap`] like the
509	/// `added` ones.
510	pub fn update(
511		&mut self,
512		added: impl IntoIterator<Item = (ValueCacheKey<H>, CachedValue<H>)>,
513		accessed: impl IntoIterator<Item = ValueCacheKeyHash>,
514	) {
515		let mut access_count = 0;
516		let mut add_count = 0;
517
518		for hash in accessed {
519			// Access every node in the map to put it to the front.
520			//
521			// Since we are only comparing the hashes here it may lead us to promoting the wrong
522			// values as the most recently accessed ones. However this is harmless as the only
523			// consequence is that we may accidentally prune a recently used value too early.
524			self.lru.get_by_hash(hash.raw(), |existing_key, _| existing_key.hash == hash);
525			access_count += 1;
526		}
527
528		// Insert all of the new items which were *not* found in the shared cache.
529		//
530		// Limit how many items we'll replace in the shared cache in one go so that
531		// we don't evict the whole shared cache nor we keep spinning our wheels
532		// evicting items which we've added ourselves in previous iterations of this loop.
533
534		self.lru.limiter_mut().items_evicted = 0;
535		self.lru.limiter_mut().max_items_evicted =
536			self.lru.len() * 100 / super::SHARED_VALUE_CACHE_MAX_REPLACE_PERCENT;
537
538		for (key, value) in added {
539			self.lru.insert(key, value);
540			add_count += 1;
541
542			if self.lru.limiter().items_evicted > self.lru.limiter().max_items_evicted {
543				// Stop when we've evicted a big enough chunk of the shared cache.
544				break
545			}
546		}
547
548		tracing::debug!(
549			target: super::LOG_TARGET,
550			"Updated the shared value cache: {} accesses, {} new values, {}/{} evicted (length = {}, known_storage_keys = {}, inline size={}/{}, heap size={}/{})",
551			access_count,
552			add_count,
553			self.lru.limiter().items_evicted,
554			self.lru.limiter().max_items_evicted,
555			self.lru.len(),
556			self.lru.limiter().known_storage_keys.len(),
557			self.lru.memory_usage(),
558			self.lru.limiter().max_inline_size,
559			self.lru.limiter().heap_size,
560			self.lru.limiter().max_heap_size
561		);
562	}
563
564	/// Reset the cache.
565	fn reset(&mut self) {
566		self.lru.clear();
567	}
568}
569
570/// The inner of [`SharedTrieCache`].
571pub(super) struct SharedTrieCacheInner<H: Hasher> {
572	node_cache: SharedNodeCache<H::Out>,
573	value_cache: SharedValueCache<H::Out>,
574}
575
576impl<H: Hasher> SharedTrieCacheInner<H> {
577	/// Returns a reference to the [`SharedValueCache`].
578	#[cfg(test)]
579	pub(super) fn value_cache(&self) -> &SharedValueCache<H::Out> {
580		&self.value_cache
581	}
582
583	/// Returns a mutable reference to the [`SharedValueCache`].
584	pub(super) fn value_cache_mut(&mut self) -> &mut SharedValueCache<H::Out> {
585		&mut self.value_cache
586	}
587
588	/// Returns a reference to the [`SharedNodeCache`].
589	#[cfg(test)]
590	pub(super) fn node_cache(&self) -> &SharedNodeCache<H::Out> {
591		&self.node_cache
592	}
593
594	/// Returns a mutable reference to the [`SharedNodeCache`].
595	pub(super) fn node_cache_mut(&mut self) -> &mut SharedNodeCache<H::Out> {
596		&mut self.node_cache
597	}
598}
599
600/// The shared trie cache.
601///
602/// It should be instantiated once per node. It will hold the trie nodes and values of all
603/// operations to the state. To not use all available memory it will ensure to stay in the
604/// bounds given via the [`CacheSize`] at startup.
605///
606/// The instance of this object can be shared between multiple threads.
607pub struct SharedTrieCache<H: Hasher> {
608	inner: Arc<RwLock<SharedTrieCacheInner<H>>>,
609}
610
611impl<H: Hasher> Clone for SharedTrieCache<H> {
612	fn clone(&self) -> Self {
613		Self { inner: self.inner.clone() }
614	}
615}
616
617impl<H: Hasher> SharedTrieCache<H> {
618	/// Create a new [`SharedTrieCache`].
619	pub fn new(cache_size: CacheSize) -> Self {
620		let total_budget = cache_size.0;
621
622		// Split our memory budget between the two types of caches.
623		let value_cache_budget = (total_budget as f32 * 0.20) as usize; // 20% for the value cache
624		let node_cache_budget = total_budget - value_cache_budget; // 80% for the node cache
625
626		// Split our memory budget between what we'll be holding inline in the map,
627		// and what we'll be holding on the heap.
628		let value_cache_inline_budget = (value_cache_budget as f32 * 0.70) as usize;
629		let node_cache_inline_budget = (node_cache_budget as f32 * 0.70) as usize;
630
631		// Calculate how much memory the maps will be allowed to hold inline given our budget.
632		let value_cache_max_inline_size =
633			SharedValueCacheMap::<H::Out>::memory_usage_for_memory_budget(
634				value_cache_inline_budget,
635			);
636
637		let node_cache_max_inline_size =
638			SharedNodeCacheMap::<H::Out>::memory_usage_for_memory_budget(node_cache_inline_budget);
639
640		// And this is how much data we'll at most keep on the heap for each cache.
641		let value_cache_max_heap_size = value_cache_budget - value_cache_max_inline_size;
642		let node_cache_max_heap_size = node_cache_budget - node_cache_max_inline_size;
643
644		tracing::debug!(
645			target: super::LOG_TARGET,
646			"Configured a shared trie cache with a budget of ~{} bytes (node_cache_max_inline_size = {}, node_cache_max_heap_size = {}, value_cache_max_inline_size = {}, value_cache_max_heap_size = {})",
647			total_budget,
648			node_cache_max_inline_size,
649			node_cache_max_heap_size,
650			value_cache_max_inline_size,
651			value_cache_max_heap_size,
652		);
653
654		Self {
655			inner: Arc::new(RwLock::new(SharedTrieCacheInner {
656				node_cache: SharedNodeCache::new(
657					node_cache_max_inline_size,
658					node_cache_max_heap_size,
659				),
660				value_cache: SharedValueCache::new(
661					value_cache_max_inline_size,
662					value_cache_max_heap_size,
663				),
664			})),
665		}
666	}
667
668	/// Create a new [`LocalTrieCache`](super::LocalTrieCache) instance from this shared cache.
669	pub fn local_cache(&self) -> super::LocalTrieCache<H> {
670		super::LocalTrieCache {
671			shared: self.clone(),
672			node_cache: Default::default(),
673			value_cache: Default::default(),
674			shared_value_cache_access: Mutex::new(super::ValueAccessSet::with_hasher(
675				schnellru::ByLength::new(super::SHARED_VALUE_CACHE_MAX_PROMOTED_KEYS),
676				Default::default(),
677			)),
678			stats: Default::default(),
679		}
680	}
681
682	/// Get a copy of the node for `key`.
683	///
684	/// This will temporarily lock the shared cache for reading.
685	///
686	/// This doesn't change the least recently order in the internal [`LruMap`].
687	#[inline]
688	pub fn peek_node(&self, key: &H::Out) -> Option<NodeOwned<H::Out>> {
689		self.inner.read().node_cache.lru.peek(key).cloned()
690	}
691
692	/// Get a copy of the [`CachedValue`] for `key`.
693	///
694	/// This will temporarily lock the shared cache for reading.
695	///
696	/// This doesn't reorder any of the elements in the internal [`LruMap`].
697	pub fn peek_value_by_hash(
698		&self,
699		hash: ValueCacheKeyHash,
700		storage_root: &H::Out,
701		storage_key: &[u8],
702	) -> Option<CachedValue<H::Out>> {
703		self.inner
704			.read()
705			.value_cache
706			.lru
707			.peek_by_hash(hash.0, |existing_key, _| existing_key.is_eq(storage_root, storage_key))
708			.cloned()
709	}
710
711	/// Returns the used memory size of this cache in bytes.
712	pub fn used_memory_size(&self) -> usize {
713		let inner = self.inner.read();
714		let value_cache_size =
715			inner.value_cache.lru.memory_usage() + inner.value_cache.lru.limiter().heap_size;
716		let node_cache_size =
717			inner.node_cache.lru.memory_usage() + inner.node_cache.lru.limiter().heap_size;
718
719		node_cache_size + value_cache_size
720	}
721
722	/// Reset the node cache.
723	pub fn reset_node_cache(&self) {
724		self.inner.write().node_cache.reset();
725	}
726
727	/// Reset the value cache.
728	pub fn reset_value_cache(&self) {
729		self.inner.write().value_cache.reset();
730	}
731
732	/// Reset the entire cache.
733	pub fn reset(&self) {
734		self.reset_node_cache();
735		self.reset_value_cache();
736	}
737
738	/// Returns the read locked inner.
739	#[cfg(test)]
740	pub(super) fn read_lock_inner(
741		&self,
742	) -> parking_lot::RwLockReadGuard<'_, SharedTrieCacheInner<H>> {
743		self.inner.read()
744	}
745
746	/// Returns the write locked inner.
747	pub(super) fn write_lock_inner(&self) -> Option<RwLockWriteGuard<'_, SharedTrieCacheInner<H>>> {
748		// This should never happen, but we *really* don't want to deadlock. So let's have it
749		// timeout, just in case. At worst it'll do nothing, and at best it'll avert a catastrophe
750		// and notify us that there's a problem.
751		self.inner.try_write_for(super::SHARED_CACHE_WRITE_LOCK_TIMEOUT)
752	}
753}
754
755#[cfg(test)]
756mod tests {
757	use super::*;
758	use sp_core::H256 as Hash;
759
760	#[test]
761	fn shared_value_cache_works() {
762		let mut cache = SharedValueCache::<sp_core::H256>::new(usize::MAX, 10 * 10);
763
764		let key = vec![0; 10];
765
766		let root0 = Hash::repeat_byte(1);
767		let root1 = Hash::repeat_byte(2);
768
769		cache.update(
770			vec![
771				(ValueCacheKey::new_value(&key[..], root0), CachedValue::NonExisting),
772				(ValueCacheKey::new_value(&key[..], root1), CachedValue::NonExisting),
773			],
774			vec![],
775		);
776
777		// Ensure that the basics are working
778		assert_eq!(1, cache.lru.limiter_mut().known_storage_keys.len());
779		assert_eq!(
780			3, // Two instances inside the cache + one extra in `known_storage_keys`.
781			Arc::strong_count(
782				cache.lru.limiter_mut().known_storage_keys.get_key_value(&key[..]).unwrap().0
783			)
784		);
785		assert_eq!(key.len(), cache.lru.limiter().heap_size);
786		assert_eq!(cache.lru.len(), 2);
787		assert_eq!(cache.lru.peek_newest().unwrap().0.storage_root, root1);
788		assert_eq!(cache.lru.peek_oldest().unwrap().0.storage_root, root0);
789		assert!(cache.lru.limiter().heap_size <= cache.lru.limiter().max_heap_size);
790		assert_eq!(cache.lru.limiter().heap_size, 10);
791
792		// Just accessing a key should not change anything on the size and number of entries.
793		cache.update(vec![], vec![ValueCacheKey::hash_data(&key[..], &root0)]);
794		assert_eq!(1, cache.lru.limiter_mut().known_storage_keys.len());
795		assert_eq!(
796			3,
797			Arc::strong_count(
798				cache.lru.limiter_mut().known_storage_keys.get_key_value(&key[..]).unwrap().0
799			)
800		);
801		assert_eq!(key.len(), cache.lru.limiter().heap_size);
802		assert_eq!(cache.lru.len(), 2);
803		assert_eq!(cache.lru.peek_newest().unwrap().0.storage_root, root0);
804		assert_eq!(cache.lru.peek_oldest().unwrap().0.storage_root, root1);
805		assert!(cache.lru.limiter().heap_size <= cache.lru.limiter().max_heap_size);
806		assert_eq!(cache.lru.limiter().heap_size, 10);
807
808		// Updating the cache again with exactly the same data should not change anything.
809		cache.update(
810			vec![
811				(ValueCacheKey::new_value(&key[..], root1), CachedValue::NonExisting),
812				(ValueCacheKey::new_value(&key[..], root0), CachedValue::NonExisting),
813			],
814			vec![],
815		);
816		assert_eq!(1, cache.lru.limiter_mut().known_storage_keys.len());
817		assert_eq!(
818			3,
819			Arc::strong_count(
820				cache.lru.limiter_mut().known_storage_keys.get_key_value(&key[..]).unwrap().0
821			)
822		);
823		assert_eq!(key.len(), cache.lru.limiter().heap_size);
824		assert_eq!(cache.lru.len(), 2);
825		assert_eq!(cache.lru.peek_newest().unwrap().0.storage_root, root0);
826		assert_eq!(cache.lru.peek_oldest().unwrap().0.storage_root, root1);
827		assert!(cache.lru.limiter().heap_size <= cache.lru.limiter().max_heap_size);
828		assert_eq!(cache.lru.limiter().items_evicted, 0);
829		assert_eq!(cache.lru.limiter().heap_size, 10);
830
831		// Add 10 other entries and this should move out two of the initial entries.
832		cache.update(
833			(1..11)
834				.map(|i| vec![i; 10])
835				.map(|key| (ValueCacheKey::new_value(&key[..], root0), CachedValue::NonExisting)),
836			vec![],
837		);
838
839		assert_eq!(cache.lru.limiter().items_evicted, 2);
840		assert_eq!(10, cache.lru.len());
841		assert_eq!(10, cache.lru.limiter_mut().known_storage_keys.len());
842		assert!(cache.lru.limiter_mut().known_storage_keys.get_key_value(&key[..]).is_none());
843		assert_eq!(key.len() * 10, cache.lru.limiter().heap_size);
844		assert_eq!(cache.lru.len(), 10);
845		assert!(cache.lru.limiter().heap_size <= cache.lru.limiter().max_heap_size);
846		assert_eq!(cache.lru.limiter().heap_size, 100);
847
848		assert!(matches!(
849			cache.lru.peek(&ValueCacheKey::new_value(&[1; 10][..], root0)).unwrap(),
850			CachedValue::<Hash>::NonExisting
851		));
852
853		assert!(cache.lru.peek(&ValueCacheKey::new_value(&[1; 10][..], root1)).is_none(),);
854
855		assert!(cache.lru.peek(&ValueCacheKey::new_value(&key[..], root0)).is_none());
856		assert!(cache.lru.peek(&ValueCacheKey::new_value(&key[..], root1)).is_none());
857
858		cache.update(
859			vec![(ValueCacheKey::new_value(vec![10; 10], root0), CachedValue::NonExisting)],
860			vec![],
861		);
862
863		assert!(cache.lru.limiter_mut().known_storage_keys.get_key_value(&key[..]).is_none());
864	}
865}
